content: now we can say that our adventures had either stumbled upon this cave or they
had been drawn to it by some strange force and as they enter the dark cave
the mage lights his staff with his light spell shining out they see the the slag
mites reaching to the ceiling so the the leader decides to move in and check it
out now as you can see I don't use squares on the tile I talk to my other
video that I feel that's very restrictive I use measuring sticks so he
can move six inches so we'll move him in and as he gets to that edge where the
first stalactite is her slag mite is there was a creature hiding there so it
leaps out in the tax so that would be initiative time and so even though these
don't physically go all the way up here you can say that they go to the ceiling
or whatever so that anything hiding behind them could jump out or attack so
it's kind of the same as a regular dungeon tile that's just more 3d and
also it's not getting in your way like this is short enough that all the
players can have access to it they don't have to worry about bumping over
something or hitting the wall or whatever so as the fight progresses our
brave adventurers push forward unfortunately two more of these strange
creatures were hiding behind more of the stalactites so our adventure is push
forward slaying the first beast and pushing forward into the cave
through strong magic and battle skills the adventurers slay the other two
creatures now in the in the gloom of the cave the mage notices that there's a
sinkhole in the back of the cave so the adventurers move up after they defeat
the creatures and now they have to decide who's gonna go down that sinkhole
or if they're all gonna go down or if they're just going to turn around leaf
maybe they feel it's too dangerous but then if they do decide to go down the
sinkhole you could have another cave section that they go into
so that would be example of the tile in use no squares needed all the
measurements were the wrists were with a stick so I hope you enjoyed this this
video and how to make this cool cave tile and we'll talk again soon
you
